Reference GuideÂ¶

Retrieve DataÂ¶

Download and read data from the R-series Geostationary Operational Environmental Satellite data.

Data is downloaded from Amazon Web Services and can be returned as a file list or read as an xarray.Dataset. If the data is not available in a local directory, it is loaded directly into memory.

https://registry.opendata.aws/noaa-goes/

Functions:

goes_latest(*[,Â satellite,Â product,Â domain,Â â€¦])

Get the latest available GOES data.

goes_nearesttime(attime[,Â within,Â â€¦])

Get the latest available GOES data.

goes_timerange([start,Â end,Â recent,Â â€¦])

Get GOES data for a time range.
goes2go.data.goes_latest(*, satellite='goes17', product='GLM', domain='C', return_as='xarray', download=True, overwrite=False, download_dir=PosixPath('/p/home/blaylock/data'), verbose=True)Â¶

Get the latest available GOES data.

Parameters

  • satellite ({'goes16', 'goes17'}) â€“

    Specify which GOES satellite. The following alias may also be used:

    • 'goes16': 16, â€˜G16â€™, or â€˜EASTâ€™

    • 'goes17': 17, â€˜G17â€™, or â€˜WESTâ€™

  • product ({'ABI', 'GLM', other GOES product}) â€“

    Specify the product name.

    • â€™ABIâ€™ is an alias for ABI-L2-MCMIP Multichannel Cloud and Moisture Imagery

    • â€™GLMâ€™ is an alias for GLM-L2-LCFA Geostationary Lightning Mapper

    Others may include 'ABI-L1b-Rad', 'ABI-L2-DMW', etc. For more available products, look at this README

  • domain ({'C', 'F', 'M'}) â€“

    ABI scan region indicator. Only required for ABI products if the given product does not end with C, F, or M.

    • C: Contiguous United States (alias â€˜CONUSâ€™)

    • F: Full Disk (alias â€˜FULLâ€™)

    • M: Mesoscale (alias â€˜MESOSCALEâ€™)

  • return_as ({'xarray', 'filelist'}) â€“ Return the data as an xarray.Dataset or as a list of files

  • download (bool) â€“

    • True: Download the data to disk to the location set by download_dir

    • False: Just load the data into memory.

  • download_dir (pathlib.Path or str) â€“ Path to save the data. Default is the users ~/data/ directory.

  • overwrite (bool) â€“

    • True: Download the file even if it exists.

    • False (default): Do not download the file if it already exists

goes2go.data.goes_nearesttime(attime, within=datetime.timedelta(seconds=3600), *, satellite='goes17', product='GLM', domain='C', return_as='xarray', download=True, overwrite=False, download_dir=PosixPath('/p/home/blaylock/data'), verbose=True)Â¶

Get the latest available GOES data.

Parameters

  • attime (datetime) â€“ Time to find the nearest observation for. May also use a pandas-interpretable datetime string.

  • within (timedelta) â€“ Timerange tht the nearest observation must be. Default is 1 hour meaning the observation must be within 1 hour of the requested attime. May also use pandas timedelta string representation. â€œ1Hâ€ for 1 hour, â€œ30minâ€ for 30 minutes, â€œ1Dâ€ for 1 day, etc.

    Others may include 'ABI-L1b-Rad', 'ABI-L2-DMW', etc. For more available products, look at this README

    • C: Contiguous United States (alias â€˜CONUSâ€™)

    • F: Full Disk (alias â€˜FULLâ€™)

    • M: Mesoscale (alias â€˜MESOSCALEâ€™)

  • return_as ({'xarray', 'filelist'}) â€“ Return the data as an xarray.Dataset or as a list of files

  • download (bool) â€“

    • True: Download the data to disk to the location set by download_dir

  • end (datetime) â€“ Required if recent is None.

    Specify which GOES satellite. The following alias may also be used:
